meanings.definition: A belief or practice resulting from ignorance, fear of the unknown, trust in magic or chance, or a false conception of causation.
meanings.sent1: Her superstition about black cats brought her bad luck.
meanings.sent2: Many people have superstitions about Friday the 13th.
meanings.sent3: His superstition about stepping on cracks made him jump over every sidewalk.
meanings.sent4: The superstition of walking under a ladder is said to bring misfortune.
meanings.sent5: The sailor's superstition of wearing a lucky charm kept him safe at sea.

meanings.definition: Irrational fear of what is unknown or mysterious, especially in connection with religion.
meanings.sent1: The superstition of ghosts haunted her dreams.
meanings.sent2: Superstition can lead people to avoid certain places or objects.
meanings.sent3: His superstition about the dark made him sleep with a nightlight.
meanings.sent4: The superstition of evil spirits lurking in the shadows gripped the town.
meanings.sent5: The old tale fed into the superstition of a cursed treasure buried in the woods.
